file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 57-30-02-06 - WING TIP POLYURETHANE FILM - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WING TIP POLYURETHANE FILM - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. The procedures given in this section are applicable to the inspection of the wing tip polyurethane film for erosion or small damage. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below: C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY WING TIP POLYURETHANE FILM - IN- ALL 57-30-02-200-801-A ♦ SPECTION/CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 57-30-02 Page 1 of 3 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-30-02-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WING TIP POLYURETHANE FILM - INSPECTION/CHECK A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to do a visual inspection on the wing tip polyurethane film. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 57-30-02/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION SRM PART II 51-71-12/1 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 561 / 661 Wing Tip D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP13-073 Rhodiasolve E-23 AR MEP21-012 Neutral liquid detergent AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Outside the aircraft I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: WEAR RUBBER GLOVES TO PROTECT YOURSELF AGAINST CHEMICAL PRODUCTS. CAUTION: THE WING TIP POLYURETHANE FILM MUST BE FREE OF OIL, GREASE, AND RESIN. (1) To remove fingerprints, dirt, and minor contaminants: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 57-30-02 Page 2 of 3 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Lightly rub the surface of the wing tip with a soft cloth soaked in neutral detergent. (b) Clean the surface with water to remove the detergent from the wing tip. (c) Dry the wet surface with a soft clean cloth or permit it to air-dry. (2) To remove oil, grease, or other heavy contaminants: (a) Lightly rub the surface of the wing tip with a soft cloth soaked in Rhodiasolve E-23 or similar product. (b) Rub the area with a clean dry cloth before the solvent evaporation. J. Inspect (Visual Inspection) the Wing Tip Polyurethane Film (Figure 601) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Visually inspect the wing tip polyurethane film for erosion or small damages. (2) If you find damage or missing polyurethane film part, do as follows: (a) Do a check to see if the aircraft structure is also damaged. If it is, refer to the applicable section of the SRM. If not, do the steps that follow: 1 If the aircraft must be released immediately, do these steps below: a Release the aircraft for up to 50 FC. b Within the 50 FC, apply speed tape, according to SRM PART II 51-71-12/1 and inspect the damaged area weekly to make sure that the speed tape is in perfect condition, or replace the affected polyurethane film. c If the speed tape is applied, release the aircraft up to next heavy maintenance check. However, the operator may reduce this interval check at his discretion. 2 If it is not necessary to release the aircraft immediately, do the replacement of the polyurethane film and make sure that there is no damage on aircraft structure. Refer to AMM MPP 57-30-02/400. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 57-30-02 Page 3 of 3 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
